intro: Dichromena ebracteata, commonly known as the white-flowered dichromena, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Dichromena ebracteata is often found in tropical and subtropical regions where the climate is warm and humid.
